item.name: Accessing the API
item.description:
1. The base URL for all QGenda REST API resources is **https://api.qgenda.com/v2**
2. Access to the API is only available via HTTPS TLS 1.2
3. Authentication method is a token-based approach
**Note:** QGenda has discontinued support for SSL and TLS 1.0/1.1 with new configurations.

item.name: Authentication
item.description: Authentication is required for all requests to the QGenda REST API, unless otherwise noted. Authentication with the REST API is performed by supplying a QGenda username/email via a POST to the login endpoint. This returns a token that must be included in all future requests. Authentication failures on subsequent requests will always return an **[HTTP 401 (Unauthorized)](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html#sec10.4.2)** status code. **Note**: The “Content-Type” in the headers for the POST must be “application/x-www-form-urlencoded” **Response from Authentication:** The response from the server will contain an access token (“access_token” field), a token type (“token_type” field), and an expiration time (“expires_in” field) represented in seconds. When the token expires, the API user will need to POST again to the login URL and receive a new token. **All future requests must have an “Authentication” header with the token type and token appended as the value. Example:** ``` Authorization: bearer eyJhbGciOiJBMjU2S1ciLCJlbmMiO... ```

item.name: Data Format
item.description:
All data returned from the QGenda REST API will be in [JSON](http://www.json.org/) format, unless otherwise noted. JSON libraries are available for most modern programming languages, and many have support built-in to the core libraries.

While not required, it is strongly recommended that requests include the [HTTP Content-Type header](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.17), set to a value of **application/json** (ex. `Content-Type: application/json`). If no Content-Type header is specified, then **application/json** will be the default in most cases. However, setting the Content-Type header to a value other than** appliction/json **is generally not supported by the QGenda REST API.

The following is a list of some popular JSON libraries for various platforms:



1. [Json.NET](http://james.newtonking.com/json) (.NET)
2. [JSON Processing/JSR 253 RI](https://jsonp.java.net/) (Java)
3. [Google Gson](https://code.google.com/p/google-gson/) (Java)
4. [JSON for Ruby](http://flori.github.io/json/) (Ruby)
5. [JSON for PHP](http://www.php.net/manual/en/book.json.php) (PHP)

item.name: Compression
item.description:
The QGenda REST API supports GZip compression of returned data. This will greatly reduce the size of the data returned by the API, resulting in faster response times and reducing bandwidth usage. The vast majority of modern web browsers and HTTP client libraries support GZip compression. **We require** that all users take advantage of GZip compression.

To enable GZip compression, the **[Accept-Encoding](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.3) **header must be included in the request, and its value must include either **gzip** or *****. Multi-values are supported, as long as **gzip** is one of the values (i.e. `Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate`)

**Example 1 (gzip):**


```
    Accept-Encoding: gzip
```


**Example 2 (*):**


```
    Accept-Encoding: *
```

item.name: OData Support
item.description:
[The Open Data Protocol (OData)](http://www.odata.org/) provides the ability to query a RESTful service, allowing for data to be retrieved in a multitude of ways from a single resource.

Some resources within the QGenda REST API support OData parameters, allowing users additional control over the data that's returned from the resource. In cases where OData parameters are supported, the resource documentation will provide additional information.

**NOTE:** By definition, **all** OData parameters, operators, and expressions are **case-sensitive**. Since OData expressions may include the names of specific object properties, those properties are also case sensitive (for instance, a property named **Date** would not be the same as a property named **date**).

**NOTE:** For readability purposes, the OData **$filter** parameter is often shown in examples with spaces and other characters that would need to be properly encoded for actual use in a URL. Users must always make sure that URLs for their requests are properly encoded.

query.description: The key for the company associated with the schedule entries

**REQUIRED**

The earliest date to retrieve schedule entries for.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note**: If startDate is specified without specifying endDate, then schedule entries will be retrieved for a single day. It is functionally equal to setting the start and end date to the same value

The latest date to retrieve schedule entries for. All dates between startDate and endDate will be included.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note:** If either endDate is not provided or if the number of days between the start and end dates is greater than the 100 days, then the endDate will be set so that the number of days from start to end is equal to 100 days.
If provided, deleted schedule entries will be included. IsStruck will be set to true.
If provided, only schedule entries that have been changed after sinceModifiedTimestamp.  Date format is yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ UTC ISO-8601. (Example:  2019-05-07T18:50:51.9239331Z)

The format we should use to interpret date fields in the request. EG “dd/MM/yyyy” or “MM/dd/yyyy” We also accept other formats like RFC1123 “DAY, dd MON yyyy hh:mm:ss” and ISO8601 “yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ” 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings
If provided, as a comma separated list of entities the specified related entities will be returned with the response. (Examples: StaffTags,TaskTags,LocationTags)

request.description:
Returns schedule entries within the date range for companies the user has access to.

Response Object: Array of [ScheduleEntry](#cecf3cdc-b32b-4b2c-8604-bd6fb59d7655)


**Note:** If GZip compression is supported/accepted by the client, up to 100 days of schedule data may be requested. If compression is not supported, then up to 31 days of schedule data may be returned.


**Note:** Times are displayed according to the task’s location time zone or, if there isn’t a task location time zone, it uses the company’s time zone instead. 


If the schedule entry’s start or end time falls within a time range affected by Daylight Saving Time (DST), the following rules apply:

*   If the **start time** falls within the **“gap”** at the start of DST, StartTime will be an hour earlier to account for the hour “lost” by the time change.
*   If the **end time** falls within the **“gap”** at the start of DST, EndTime will be an hour later that the schedule entry end time to account for the hour “lost” by the time change.
*   If the **start time** falls within the **“fall back”** hour at the end of DST, StartDateUtc and EndDateUtc will use the **non-DST UTC**.
*   If the **end time** falls within the **“fall back”** hour at the end of DST, StartDateUtc and EndDateUtc will use the **DST UTC**.

**For tracking schedule changes:**

We recommend that you first seed your database for the necessary date range you want to track, by calling this endpoint without **sinceModifiedTimestamp**. Once that's done, you can take the **MAX** of the returned **LastModifiedDateUTC** property of that dataset for that same date range, and provide that as the **sinceModifiedTimestamp** parameter when you next call **GET /schedule** to get only changes. Then, continue to take the new **MAX** of **LastModifiedDateUTC** for the next call with **sinceModifiedTimestamp**. 


By default we do not include deleted assignments (aka schedule entries). In order to include deleted assignments, you can send **includeDeletes=true** and we will return anything deleted for the date range (and since **sinceModifiedTimestamp** if provided) as entries with their **isStruck** property = true.

**REQUIRED**

The earliest date to retrieve open shifts for.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note**: If startDate is specified without specifying endDate, then open shifts will be retrieved for a single day. It is functionally equal to setting the start and end date to the same value

The latest date to retrieve open shifts for. All dates between startDate and endDate will be included.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note:** If either endDate is not provided or if the number of days between the start and end dates is greater than the 100 days, then the endDate will be set so that the number of days from start to end is equal to 100 days.

The format we should use to interpret date fields in the request. EG “dd/MM/yyyy” or “MM/dd/yyyy” We also accept other formats like RFC1123 “DAY, dd MON yyyy hh:mm:ss” and ISO8601 “yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ”

request.description:
Returns open shifts for a date range.

Response Object: Array of [OpenShift](#9847907e-e90f-49e2-bf5d-8591902087c2)


**Note:** Times are displayed according to the task’s location time zone or, if there isn’t a task location time zone, it uses the company’s time zone instead. 


If the open shift’s start or end time falls within a time range affected by Daylight Saving Time (DST), the following rules apply:

*   If the **start time** falls within the **“gap”** at the start of DST, StartTime will be an hour earlier to account for the hour “lost” by the time change.
*   If the **end time** falls within the **“gap”** at the start of DST, EndTime will be an hour later that the open shift end time to account for the hour “lost” by the time change.
*   If the **start time** falls within the **“fall back”** hour at the end of DST, StartDateUtc and EndDateUtc will use the **non-DST UTC**.
*   If the **end time** falls within the **“fall back”** hour at the end of DST, StartDateUtc and EndDateUtc will use the **DST UTC**.

query.description:
**REQUIRED**

The key for the company associated with the schedule entries

**REQUIRED**

The earliest date to retrieve schedule entries for.

Values should be in M/d/yyyy or MM/dd/yyyy format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**REQUIRED**

The latest date to retrieve schedule entries for. All dates between startDate and endDate will be included.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

Note: If the number of days between the start and end dates is greater than the maximum number of days allowed (380), then the endDate will be changed so that the number of days from start to end is equal to the maximum number of days.
When ignoreHoliday is set to true, the calculation of rotations will ignore days that would break the rotation that are QGenda holidays

When ignoreWeekend is set to true, the calculation of rotations will ignore days that would break the rotation that are weekend days. Note: Weekends are defined for the QGenda Company as Fri, Sat or Sat, Sun.

The format we should use to interpret date fields in the request. EG “dd/MM/yyyy” or “MM/dd/yyyy” We also accept other formats like RFC1123 “DAY, dd MON yyyy hh:mm:ss” and ISO8601 “yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ” 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings

request.description:
Returns schedule rotations for a specific company and date range. 
Rotations will be followed to their beginning/end even if the dates for those boundaries are outside the rangeStartDate and rangeEndDate range provided (up to 6 months before rangeStartDate and 6 months after requestEndDate). 

Resource URL:
https://api.qgenda.com/v2/schedule/rotations

Returns:
An array of [ScheduleRotation](#84abc0d0-9f06-4465-80aa-cabc9cb98c42) objects, in JSON format

Maximum number of items returned on one result page. Incomplete pages can be detected by a non-empty nextPageToken field in the response. By default the value is 100 items. The page size can never be larger than 100 items.
Token specifying which result page to return.

Token obtained from the nextSyncToken field returned on the last page of results from the previous list request. It makes the result of this list request contain only items that have changed since then.

If the syncToken expires, the server will respond with a 410 GONE response code and the client should clear its storage and perform a full synchronization without any syncToken.

The default is to return all items.

urlencoded.description:
**REQUIRED**

The ID of the task

**REQUIRED if LocationId blank**

GUID for company

**REQUIRED if CompKey blank**

ID of the location in the company for the task

Task occurs on Monday

**At least one Day of Week is REQUIRED as true**

Task occurs on Tuesday

**At least one Day of Week is REQUIRED as true**

Task occurs on Wednesday

**At least one Day of Week is REQUIRED as true**

Task occurs on Thursday

**At least one Day of Week is REQUIRED as true**

Task occurs on Friday

**At least one Day of Week is REQUIRED as true**

Task occurs on Saturday

**At least one Day of Week is REQUIRED as true**

Task occurs on Sunday

**At least one Day of Week is REQUIRED**
Abbreviated name/label

The background color used when displaying the task, as a hex color string (i.e. "0c0c0c", "ffffff", etc). This is typically used as a means of grouping similar staff members together.

NOTE: In some cases, the color black ("000000") may be represented as the string "0"

The ID of the task used for integration with an external billing system


Note: Field is only available via API - currently not configurable
The role associated with call assignments
Contact Information
The ID of the Department
Syncs to calendar as open availability
The external call system identifier
Enables waitlisting for the task
The end date of the task
Enforces time compatibility
The external call priority
The ID of the task used for integration with an external call scheduling system
The extension
The task is fully compatible with other tasks by default
Will hide this task when syncing calendar
If true, task will not show opens on New Admin Calendar views
Task is not assigned via automation
The name of the task
The notes for the task
The notification list for the task
The overridden sort order
The ID of the task used for integration with an external payroll system
The related payroll unit identifier
Whether this task requires a time punch
The end time of the task will show with the name
Task will only show on Admin/New Admin
Sets optional "TaskVisibility" value. The only accepted values will be: Show Everywhere, Personal, Show On Admin Only
Open shifts will show on New Admin Calendar views
The start time of the task will show with the name
If true, the task will show times when edited
The start date of the task
Suppresses request emails and notificaitons about the task
Syncs task to calendar as an all day event

The text color associated with the task, as a hex color string (i.e. "0c0c0c", "ffffff", etc).

NOTE: In some cases, the color black ("000000") may be represented as the string "0"
The number of hours off the staff should receive after working the shift
Determines whether the task is a Working or an Unavailable task
Task can be counted as a part of a rotation when true

query.description:
**REQUIRED**
The identifier for a daily configuration

**REQUIRED**
The earliest date to retrieve daily cases for.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note**: If startDate is specified without specifying endDate, then daily cases will be retrieved for a single day. It is functionally equal to setting the start and end date to the same value

The latest date to retrieve daily cases for. All dates between startDate and endDate will be included.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note**: If the number of days between the start and end dates is greater than the maximum number of days allowed (100 or 31), then the endDate will be changed so that the number of days from start to end is equal to the maximum number of days.

The format we should use to interpret date fields in the request. EG “dd/MM/yyyy” or “MM/dd/yyyy” We also accept other formats like RFC1123 “DAY, dd MON yyyy hh:mm:ss” and ISO8601 “yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ” 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings
If provided, as a comma separated list of entities the specified related entities will be returned with the response. (StandardFields, PatientInformation)

query.description:
**REQUIRED**

The key for the company associated with the daily cases

**REQUIRED**

The earliest date to retrieve daily cases for.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note**: If startDate is specified without specifying endDate, then time events will be retrieved for a single day. It is functionally equal to setting the start and end date to the same value

The latest date to retrieve daily cases for. All dates between startDate and endDate will be included.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note:** If the number of days between the start and end dates is greater than the maximum number of days allowed (100 or 31), then the endDate will be changed so that the number of days from start to end is equal to the maximum number of days.

The format we should use to interpret date fields in the request. EG “dd/MM/yyyy” or “MM/dd/yyyy” We also accept other formats like RFC1123 “DAY, dd MON yyyy hh:mm:ss” and ISO8601 “yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ” 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings
If provided, as a comma separated list of entities the specified related entities will be returned with the response. (Task, Supervisors, DirectProviders)

request.description:
Returns the daily cases within a specified date range.  

Response Object: Array of [DailyCase](#f6bdc42b-de76-4474-8140-9f9a49ac2dc3)

**Note**: If GZip compression is supported/accepted by the client, up to 100 days of DailyCase data may be requested. If compression is not supported, then up to 31 days of DailyCase data may be returned.

query.description:
**REQUIRED**

The key for the company associated with the time events

**REQUIRED**

The earliest date to retrieve time events for.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note**: If startDate is specified without specifying endDate, then time events will be retrieved for a single day. It is functionally equal to setting the start and end date to the same value

The latest date to retrieve time events for. All dates between startDate and endDate will be included.

Values should be in M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY format (ex. 11/1/2014, 5/23/2013, 01/06/2014)

**Note:** If the number of days between the start and end dates is greater than the maximum number of days allowed (100 or 31), then the endDate will be changed so that the number of days from start to end is equal to the maximum number of days.

The format we should use to interpret date fields in the request. EG “dd/MM/yyyy” or “MM/dd/yyyy” We also accept other formats like RFC1123 “DAY, dd MON yyyy hh:mm:ss” and ISO8601 “yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ” 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings

When IsUniversallyLocalDates is set to true, GET /timeevent return time events according to the timezone of the location where the time punch occured. 

NOTE: By default, IsUniversallyLocalDates will be false if not provided
If provided, as a comma separated list of entities the specified related entities will be returned with the response. (Examples: ScheduleEntry, Task, StaffMember)

request.description:
Returns TimeEvents (clocked or logged time) for a specific company and date range. 

Response Object: Array of [TimeEvent](#a8a3bcf9-7039-448c-a64c-93d2fb938d6a)


**Note**: If GZip compression is supported/accepted by the client, up to 100 days of TimeEvent data may be requested. If compression is not supported, then up to 31 days of TimeEvent data may be returned.

item.name: ScheduleEntry
item.description:
Name Type Description
ScheduleKey GUID The unique or primary key for a schedule entry
CallRole String Call role of the task (Max Length: 64)
CompKey GUID/UUID The key for the company associated with the schedule entry
Credit Decimal The credit amount associated with the schedule entry
Date Date The date of the schedule entry, excluding time, in local time
StartDateUTC DateTime The start date and time of the schedule entry in UTC
EndDateUTC DateTime The end date and time of the schedule entry in UTC
EndDate Date The end date of the schedule entry in local time
EndTime Time/Timespan The end time of the schedule entry in local time

NOTE: A time of 12:03 AM (00:03) indicates that no end time has been specified for the schedule entry

IsCred Boolean If true, then the schedule entry includes a credit amount
IsSaved Boolean If true, then the schedule entry has been saved
IsPublished Boolean If true, then the schedule entry has been published
IsLocked Boolean If true, then the schedule entry has been locked
IsStruck Boolean If true, then the schedule entry has been struck from the schedule and is considered to be cancelled
Notes String Notes associated with the assignment. (Max Length: 256)
IsNotePrivate Boolean If true, then the note has been marked as private and can only be viewed if the user has the appropriate permissions
StaffAbbrev String The abbreviated name/label for the staff member (Max Length: 16)
StaffBillSysId String The ID of the staff member used for integration with an external billing system (Max Length: 64)
StaffEmail String The staff member's email address (Max Length: 128)
StaffEmrId String The ID of the staff member used for integration with an external EMR (electronic medical record) system (Max Length: 64)
StaffErpId String External Enterprise Resource Planning System ID for the staff member (Max Length: 50)
StaffInternalId String Internal ID for the staff member (Max Length: 50)
StaffExtCallSysId String The ID of the staff member used for integration with an external call scheduling system (Max Length: 64)
StaffFName String The staff member's first name (Max Length: 256)
StaffId String A multi-purpose, arbitrary, identifier associated with the staff member (Max Length: 256)
StaffKey GUID/UUID The key for the staff member associated with the schedule entry
StaffLName String The staff member's last name (Max Length: 256)
StaffMobilePhone String The staff member's mobile phone # (Max Length: 20)
StaffNpi String The staff member's National Provider ID (Max Length: 64)
StaffPager String The staff member's pager # (Max Length: 20)
StaffPayrollId String The ID of the staff member used for integration with an external payroll system (Max Length: 64)
StaffTags Array<Tag> A list of tags attributed to the staff member
StartDate Date The start date of the schedule entry in local time
StartTime Time/Timespan The start time for the schedule entry.

NOTE: A time of 12:03 AM (00:03) indicates that no start time has been specified for the schedule entry

TaskAbbrev String The abbreviated name/label for the task (Max Length: 32)
TaskBillSysId String The ID of the task used for integration with an external billing system

Note: Field is only available via API - currently not configurable (Max Length: 64)
TaskContactInformation String Contact Information associated with the task. (Max Length: 3072)
TaskExtCallSysId String The ID of the task used for integration with an external call scheduling system (Max Length: 64)
TaskId String A multi-purpose, arbitrary, identifier associated with the task (Max Length: 64)
TaskEmrId String The ID of the task used for integration with an external EMR (electronic medical record) system (Max Length: 64)
TaskCallPriority String The call priority of the task (Max Length: 10)
TaskDepartmentId String The ID of the Department (Max Length: 64)
TaskIsPrintEnd Boolean If true, then the end time associated with the task is displayed any time the task appears in QGenda

NOTE: this property can be null

TaskIsPrintStart Boolean If true, then the start time associated with the task is displayed any time the task appears in QGenda

NOTE: this property can be null

TaskKey GUID/UUID The key for the task associated with the schedule entry
TaskName String The full name of the task (Max Length: 256)
TaskPayrollId String The ID of the task used for integration with an external payroll system. (Max Length: 64)
TaskShiftKey GUID/UUID The key for the task shift associated with the Task.
TaskType String The type associated with the Task. i.e Working or Unavailable
TaskTags Array<Tag> A list of tags attributed to the Task
LocationName String The name of the location associated with the Task (Max Length: 128)
LocationAbbrev String The location abbreviation (Max Length: 40)
LocationID String The location ID (Max Length: 64)
LocationAddress String The Location address (Max Length: 512)
LocationTags Array<Tag> A list of tags attributed to the Location
TimeZone String Time zone associated to the location or the company if location does not have a time zone configured (Max Length: 64)
LastModifiedDateUTC DateTime UTC Timestamp of last modification to the Schedule Entry. (Example: 2019-05-07T18:50:51.9239331Z)
IsRotationTask Boolean Task can be counted as a part of a rotation when true

item.name: Request
item.description:
Name Type Description
RequestId String The ID of the request (Max Length: 36)
StaffNpi String The staff member's National Provider ID (Max Length: 64)
TaskId String The ID of the task (Max Length: 64)
CallRole String The role associated with call assignments (Max Length: 64)
CompKey GUID/UUID The key for the company associated with the request
Credit Decimal The credit amount associated with the request
Date Date The date of the request, excluding time
EndTime Time/Timespan The end time of the request

NOTE: A time of 12:03 AM (00:03) indicates that no end time has been specified for the request

Notes String Notes associated with the request. (Max Length: 256)
RequestKey GUID/UUID The unique identifier for the request
RequestType String The type of request. Possible values are “Add” or “Remove”.
RequestStatus String The status of the request. Possible values are “Pending”, “Approved”, and “Denied”.
ResolutionDate Date The date the request was resolved. Resolution of a request is either an approval or denial.
StaffAbbrev String The abbreviated name/label for the staff member (Max Length: 16)
StaffFName String The staff member's first name (Max Length: 256)
StaffKey GUID/UUID The key for the staff member associated with the request
StaffLName String The staff member's last name (Max Length: 256)
StaffPayrollId String The ID of the staff member used for integration with an external payroll system (Max Length: 64)
StartTime Time/Timespan The start time for the request.

NOTE: A time of 12:03 AM (00:03) indicates that no start time has been specified for the request

SubmittedByUser String The first and last name of the user who submitted the request (Max Length: 256 and 256 for first and last name each)
SubmittedDate Date The date the request was submitted
TaskAbbrev String The abbreviated name/label for the task (Max Length: 32)
TaskKey GUID/UUID The key for the task associated with the request

item.name: TimeEvent
item.description:
| Name | Type | Description | |-|-|-| | **`ActualClockIn`** | Datetime | The time in which the staff clocked in or selected at the time of adding a punch. This will be exposed as UTC. | | **`ActualClockOut`** | Datetime | The time in which the staff clocked out or selected at the time of adding a punch. This will be exposed as UTC. | | **`CompanyKey`** | GUID/UUID | The key for the company associated with the request | | **`Date`** | Date | The date of the time punch, excluding time. | | **`DayOfWeek`** | String | The day of the week that the TimeEvent is associated to. For planned punches in which staff had a schedule assignment that day, this will be the day of the week that the schedule assignment falls on. For unplanned punches this will be the day of the week that the start time falls on. | | **`Duration`** | Integer | The total length of the effective punch in minutes | | **`EffectiveClockIn`** | Datetime | The clock in time that is used for pay rules and punch duration following the application of all punch rounding rules. This will be exposed as UTC. | | **`EffectiveClockOut`** | Datetime | The clock out time that is used for pay rules and punch duration following the application of all punch rounding rules. This will be exposed as UTC. | | **`IsClockInGeoVerified`** | Boolean | Identifies TimeEvents in which the Clock In geo-verified for a provided location. | | **`IsClockOutGeoVerified`** | Boolean | Identifies TimeEvents in which the Clock Out is geo-verified for a provided location. | | **`IsEarly`** | Boolean | Identifies TimeEvents in which the user clocked in Early. | | **`IsLate`** | Boolean | Identifies TimeEvents in which the clock in exceeds the late threshold set for the company. (ex: Shift is scheduled to start at 8a, late threshold is set to 15 minutes. If the user clocks in at 8:14 the TimeEvent is not late. If the user clocks in at 8:16 the TimeEvent is late. | | **`IsExcessiveDuration`** | Boolean | Identifies TimeEvents in which the duration exceeds the task shift’s typical duration. | | **`IsExtended`** | Boolean | Identifies TimeEvents that exceed the extended time punch threshold set for the company. | | **`IsStruck`** | Boolean | Identifies TimeEvents that were struck/removed. | | **`IsUnplanned`** | Boolean | Identifies TimeEvents that were not planned (not associated to a ScheduleEntry). | | **`FlagsResolved`** | Boolean | | | **`Notes`** | String | Notes associated with the TimeEvent.
(Max Length: 250) | | **`ReasonCode`** | String | The reason associated to a manual add or edit for a time event.
(Max Length: 64) | | **`ReasonCodeId`** | String | The ID of the reason associated to a manual add or edit for a time event.
(Max Length: 32) | | **`ScheduleEntry`** | String | The schedule entry that the TimeEvent is associated with. This identifies if the punch is associated to a scheduled assignment. If empty, the punch is not associated to a schedule assignment. | | **`ScheduleEntryKey`** | GUID/UUID | The key for the schedule entry that the TimeEvent is associated with. This identifies if the punch is associated to a scheduled assignment. If empty, the punch is not associated to a schedule assignment. | | **`StaffKey`** | GUID/UUID | The key for the staff member associated with the TimeEvent. | | **`TaskKey`** | GUID/UUID | The key for the task associated with the TimeEvent. | | **`TaskShiftKey`** | GUID/UUID | The key for the task shift associated with the TimeEvent. | | **`TimePunchEventKey`** | Integer | Unique identifier for the time punch. | | **`TimeZone`** | String | The time zone configured for the company.
(Max Length: 64) | | **`ActualClockInLocal`** | Datetime | The time in which the staff clocked in or selected at the time of adding a punch. This will be exposed in local time according to the company’s Time Zone. | | **`ActualClockOutLocal`** | Datetime | The time in which the staff clocked out or selected at the time of adding a punch. This will be exposed in local time according to the company’s Time Zone. | | **`EffectiveClockInLocal`** | Datetime | The clock in time that is used for pay rules and punch duration following the application of all punch rounding rules. This will be exposed in local time according to the company’s Time Zone. | | **`EffectiveClockOutLocal`** | Datetime | The clock out time that is used for pay rules and punch duration following the application of all punch rounding rules. This will be exposed in local time according to the company’s Time Zone. | | **`LastModifiedDate`** | Datetime | The time that the punch was last modified. This will be exposed as UTC. |

item.name: StaffTarget
item.description:
| Name | Type | Description |
|-|-|-|
| **`CompanyKey`** | `GUID/UUID` | The key for the company associated with the staff target |
| **`Name`** | `String` | The name of the staff target |
| **`Key`** | `Int` | Internal key for staff target |
| **`OccurrenceNumber`** | `Int` | Value of occurrence of staff target |
| **`OccurrenceType`** | `String` | Type of time period the staff target applies to (Days, Weeks, Months, Years, Current View) |
| **`StartDate`** | `Date` | The start date of the staff target |
| **`EndDate`** | `Date` | The end date of the staff target |
| **`IncludeInAlgorithm`** | `Boolean` | If true, staff target is used in scheduling algorithm |
| **`TargetType`** | `String` | The property that the staff target is counting |
| **`WeekDefinitionType`** | `String` | Specifies what day the week starts on when counting weeks |
| **`CountType`** | `String` | Specifies if counting by shifts (actual) or credit values |
| **`DefaultMin`** | `Decimal` | The default minimum value for a new staff |
| **`DefaultIdeal`** | `Decimal` | The default ideal value for a new staff |
| **`DefaultMax`** | `Decimal` | The default maximum value for a new staff |
| **`DefaultMin5WeekMonth`** | `Decimal` | The default minimum value of weeks in a 5 week month for a new staff |
| **`DefaultIdeal5WeekMonth`** | `Decimal` | The default ideal value of weeks in a 5 week month for a new staff |
| **`DefaultMax5WeekMonth`** | `Decimal` | The default maximum value of weeks in a 5 week month for a new staff |
| **`ManualValidationCheck`** | `String` | The field that validation will compare against when manually scheduling |
| **`ErrorMessage`** | `String` | The custom error message for this staff target |
| **`Tasks`** | `Array` | A list of details on each task included in the staff target |
|   **`TaskName`** | `String` | The name of the task |
|   **`TaskAbbreviation`** | `String` | Abbreviated name of task |
|   **`TaskKey`** | `GUID/UUID` | The unique, primary key for the task |
|   **`TaskID`** | `String` | A multi-purpose, arbitrary, identifier for the task |
|   **`TaskShiftKey`** | `GUID/UUID` | The unique, primary key for the task on this day of the week |
|   **`DayOfTheWeek`** | `String` | Day of the week for this task shift |
| **`Staff`** | `Array` | A list of details on each staff included in the staff target (only if ‘&includes=Staff’ is provided) |
|   **`StaffFirstName`** | `String` | The first name of the staff |
|   **`StaffLastName`** | `String` | The last name of the staff |
|   **`StaffAbbreviation`** | `String` | The abbreviated name of the staff |
|   **`StaffId`** | `String` | A multi-purpose, arbitrary, identifier for the staff |
|   **`Targets`** | `Array` | A list of staff target details for this staff |
|     **`EffectiveDate`** | `Date` | The date that the values apply from for this staff |
|     **`Min`** | `Decimal` | The minimum value for this staff |
|     **`Ideal`** | `Decimal` | The ideal value for this staff |
|     **`Max`** | `Decimal` | The maximum value for this staff |
|     **`Min5WeekMonth`** | `Decimal` | The minimum value of weeks for this staff in a 5 week month |
|     **`Ideal5WeekMonth`** | `Decimal` | The ideal value of weeks for this staff in a 5 week month |
|     **`Max5WeekMonth`** | `Decimal` | The maximum value of weeks for this staff in a 5 week month |
|     **`IsActive`** | `Boolean` | If true, staff is active in this staff target |
| **`Profiles`** | `Array` | A list of details on each profile included in the staff target (only if ‘&includes=Profiles’ is provided) |
|   **`ProfileName`** | `String` | The name of the profile |
|   **`ProfileKey`** | `GUID/UUID` | The unique, primary key for the profile |
|   **`ShowOnBottomPanel`** | `Boolean` | If true, staff target appears in bottom panel for users with this profile |
|   **`ShowOnStatsTab`** | `Boolean` | If true, staff target appears on Stats tab for users with this profile |
|   **`ValidateOnAdminTab`** | `Boolean` | If true, this staff target will be included in admin tab validation |
| **`Locations`** | `Array` | A list of details on each location included in the staff target (only if ‘&includes=Locations’ is provided) |
|   **`LocationName`** | `String` | The name of the location |
|   **`LocationID`** | `String` | The ID of the location |

| -------------------- | --------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **`RoomKey`**              | **`GUID`**     | Key for the room                                                           |
| **`RoomName`**             | `String`          | The name of the room                                                                |
| **`RoomAbbreviation`**     | `String`          | The abbreviation of the room                                                        |
| **`RoomNumber`**           | `String`          | The number of the room                                                              |
| **`RoomFloor`**            | `String`          | The floor of the room                                                               |
| **`LocationName`**         | `String`          | The name of location with which the room is associated                              |
| **`LocationAbbreviation`** | `String`          | The abbreviation of location with which the room is associated                      |
| **`LocationKey`**          | `Number`          | The key of location with which the room is associated                               |
| **`ExternalId1`**          | `String`          | The ExternalId1 value                                                               |
| **`ExternalId2`**          | `String`          | The ExternalId2 value                                                               |
| **`ExternalId3`**          | `String`          | The ExternalId3 value                                                               |
| **`ExternalId4`**          | `String`          | The ExternalId4 value                                                               |
| **`ExternalId5`**          | `String`          | The ExternalId5 value                                                               |
| **`StartDate`**            | `Date/Time`       | The date the room becomes active. If no date is specified, this field is omitted.   |
| **`EndDate`**              | `Date/Time`       | The date the room becomes inactive. If no date is specified, this field is omitted. |
| **`RoomShifts*`**          | `Array` | An array noting the days of the week for which the room is enabled                  |
| **`RoomTags*`**            | `Array`   | An array of tags associated with the room                                           |

item.name: Future Changes and API Versioning
item.description:
QGenda enhances our REST API as new features are introduced in our product. All API changes are categorized into either non-breaking changes or breaking changes. QGenda reserves the right to make non-breaking changes to the API without creating a new version of the API. Any breaking changes would only be released in a new version of the REST API. Non-Breaking Changes
We consider the following to be examples of non-breaking changes:
  • Adding a new resource
  • Adding a new property to an existing object
  • Adding a new operation (i.e. HTTP POST, PUT, or DELETE) to an existing resource
  • Adding a new object, as long as the object is only used by new resources or new resource operations
  • Adding an alternate set of parameters for an existing resource (overloading)
  • Adding new optional parameters to a resource, where exclusion of those parameters will maintain the same behavior that was present prior to adding the new parameters
Breaking Changes
We consider the following to be examples of breaking changes:
  • Addition of a new required input parameter
  • Removal of an existing input parameter (whether required or optional)
  • Removal of a response property
  • Changing the meaning of an existing response property
  • Changing the name or data type of an existing input parameter or output value
  • Removal of an endpoint
  • Changing the response error codes of an existing endpoint
